website_summaries.verdict: The Samsung 840 series is an excellent entry-level solid-state drive for budget and general users, but not really a good buy for advanced or professional users.
pros: The Samsung 840 series solid-state drive (SSD) is affordable, good-looking, and offers very good performance
cons: The Samsung 840 comes with just three, not five years of warranty coverage and is likely to have shorter lifespan than others of the same capacity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is very affordable and relatively fast SSD for the masses. Yes, you can get a Pro version or OCZ Vector which are overall faster, bot this is plenty fast for the desktop user. My buddy's PC boots into Windows 7 Ultimate 64 bit desktop in 7 seconds after a clean install and fast boot enabled. Other components (This is about $1000 build) - feel free to copy for your build: 1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. 9.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Enable TRIM if you're using older MAC OS
customer_reviews.text: It worked great when I first got it. 4 months later it failed. Amazon won't let me return or exchange because it's been 4 months. Samsung is giving me the run-around on their warranty. If you get one that works, it's a great product. ...Edit... I didn't have TRIM support enabled. I would suspect that other reviewers stating their drives died within a few months suffered from the same problem. Samsung eventually sent me another drive and the tech support informed me about enabling trim on the Mac OS. Newer Mac OS automatically support TRIM. The replacement Drive has been working incredibly well with TRIM support enabled for over a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja Jim

customer_reviews.title: Samsung's have been by far the most reliable and best performance. This drive is now 2 years old ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned, Crucial, Intel and Samsung SSDs over the years. Of all my drives, Samsung's have been by far the most reliable and best performance. This drive is now 2 years old and has performed flawlessly. I purchased another Samsung last year for my daughter. As it stands I will not be being another brand of SSDs for the foreseeable future. Note on Samsung, these are the only Samsung Products I own. I threw out their TV and wont touch their phones. Their Drive flat Rock though.
customer_reviews.author: MikadoWu

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these drives and they are great. While we all are not sure of the longevity of any new technology. The features of this drive set it apart. It has great cloning software, it has software you load and optimize the drive to your system and easy firmware updates. You really should check those regularly. I recommend this drive. Samsung makes a good drive. But, sadly their PC and Laptop support is horrible. I am still waiting on my replacement OS DVD. Luck for me I had another copy of Windows 8 so I could install and give this great review of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install in a MacBook Pro. Here are some specs of the before and after replacing the stock 500GB hard drive with this SSD. Startup to login screen: Before 52.2 seconds, After 47 seconds. Login to ready to use: Before 11.3 seconds, After 2.2 seconds. iTunes open with close to 7000 song library: Before 8.8 seconds, After 1.5 seconds. Final Cut Pro open and ready: Before 33.7 seconds, After 5.7 seconds. iPhoto open: Before 16 seconds, After 3 seconds. Photoshop CS5 open: Before 11.3 seconds, After 2.7 seconds. I was getting around 73 Mbps write and read speeds before, and 350 Mbps after. It's insane. Feels like a brand new computer!
customer_reviews.author: An Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: decent hd, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I never owned a solid state hard drive previously but I didn't know what to expect other than it should be extremely fast. To date, I have been impressed with speed, but not amazed. I also enjoy the added security of solid state storage compared to traditional disk hard drives that I have had bad experiences in the past. The only issue I have had with this device was during the install, the sata connection on the back was very tight & was worried about breaking the connection pin in the back. Luckily, with more force than expected, I was able to connect the ssd to my motherboard & everything has been working as expected.
customer_reviews.author: drew kohl

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic SSD
customer_reviews.text: Moving to a SSD is the best thing I could have done for my laptop. Booting Win7 now takes about 10 seconds instead of over 30 and the low-heat and low-noise is also a real blessing. It did make some of my applications obsolete (disk defragmentation) but SSDs do not work like the old hard drive technology and access time is not a mechanical limitation. The optimization software from Samsung works great and the size is perfect for my needs (I store big stuff on a RAID-2 NAS). Shipping, delivery, and price were all super and you can buy from confidence from this seller. See my blog at  for more reviews and DIY articles.
customer_reviews.author: Inline_Phil

customer_reviews.title: Faaaaast
customer_reviews.text: After installing this drive, I saw a huge gain in performance. Boot times dropped from ~70 seconds down to ~30 seconds. Photoshop launch time dropped from ~20 seconds to ~5 seconds. Games load fast, and working with large files in Photoshop is a breeze. On the Windows Experience Index, this drive scores a maximum rating of 7.9. Reliability has been good so far, but I do use Acronis to keep a backup image on a conventional hard disk. I can't wait until >1TB SSD drives become readily available.
customer_reviews.author: Kodz

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance SSD - Poor Transfer software included
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed the Samsung 120GB SSD and its ability to increase the performance of my computer overall. Boot times are extremely fast applications load much faster and do not hang during use and I am delighted with the price and upgrade to my system. the only negative i have experienced with this product is that the data transfer software that it comes with is cumbersome to use and doesn't allow you transfer portions of files to the new drive. I reloaded windows 8 to the drive and transferred files with another software application so that i got the functionality that I wanted. Overall I see this as a great purchase decision and well worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Randi & John Huston

customer_reviews.title: Great price, super easy product to use.
customer_reviews.text: I really really like the way you transfer your data from another hard drive. The samsung 840 comes with a cd which helps you copy everything from you existing harddrive (in my case my mechanical non ssd harddrive) to this one just in a few clicks. very easy software to do that. which makes it very easy to have your stuff on the new ssd. I have two of this now and it works great and its been few years since i have used it. great price for such a nice product. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Subham Dangol

customer_reviews.title: Good drive, but annoying blue screens.
customer_reviews.text: This is an good solid state drive, but I had to install the Samsung Magic application to stabilize it. Every now and then, I'm encountering blue screen errors and I'm checking the registry on why this is happening. But on start-ups, this is a quick drive to have and it's a joy accessing files. When I copied the OS, applications, and files via a serial ATA cable adapter, I may have copied something else along the way. I don't know. If the blue screen continues, I may have to have a tech look at it. Overall, still a good SSD to have.
customer_reviews.author: OdieMan

customer_reviews.title: Best way to upgrade an old computer
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to replace my hard drive with a solid state drive but I waited for a reasonable price. Amazon had a deal I couldn't pass up. The solid state drive dramatically improved the performance of my system. The system starts very quickly and programs load almost instantaneously. The software included with the Samsung drive is simple to use. It duplicated my OS drive to the solid state drive. I replaced the old drive with the solid state drive. I was up and running in a half hour. I am extremely satisfied with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Bay 6

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of tech, ideal for an HPC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SSD for my new HPC, which I need for some computationally intensive tasks. Installing it wasn't so easy, but that's mainly due to the architecture of the computer. The product came with all the essential cables. Once the computer could recognize the device, everything was smooth sailing from then onwards. Installing the OS was a breeze and running programs on that disk, even through a relatively slow OS, is exceptionally fast. I'd recommend getting a health monitoring program though, such as HDDlife or SSD sentinel to ensure that the SSD's wear and tear doesn't cause you any data loss issues.
customer_reviews.author: Z.V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drive, excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent solid state drive. Included software is very informative and useful. Drive itself is small, silent, and easy to install. Required cables should come with your motherboard or power supply, so don't bother purchasing the install kit (this one will do) unless you are upgrading only your drive. With new system builds, SATA cables and power cables should come with your other components. I've read very technical reviews discussing read/write speeds, I wouldn't really bother with reading those reviews. Bottom line, excellent product, easy to install, reliable. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Wingman Blues

customer_reviews.title: Best improvement you can make (next to adequate Ram) to any old or even brand new system!
customer_reviews.text: Best improvement you can make (next to adequate Ram) to any old or even brand new system! I bought a brand new HP SleehBook 255wm from WalMart for like $350 and immediately upped Ram to 16GB and the baby 120 gb HDrine to this Samsung ISD, Now windows boots in like 2 seconds (from sleep) which until it's battery goes flat and I recharge it, to about 10-15 seconds, not minutes, and I mean even after using this drive hard for over 6 months it cold booted today in 15 seconds! This drive Rocks!, next upgrade is to the 1TB drive, next year for the HP'b' day,
customer_reviews.author: Walterj7

customer_reviews.title: If God made digital memory - this would be it!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little drive for a secondary laptop. Windows 8 installed on it quickly, and the system now boots up in just seconds and the system runs everything perfectly. The biggest change I found is in loading programs. Internet browsers which usually take 10-15 seconds to settle in are up almost instantly now. Would definitely recommend this SSD to others. I had originally tried the Sandisk 128gb Ultra, but that seemed to have some I/O issues - it would take forever to format and the Windows installation took 8+ hrs and never really worked right. Not a single issue with this Samsung though!
customer_reviews.author: jaybob

customer_reviews.title: the chips were not as good, and the Windows installation routine for SSD was ...
customer_reviews.text: After six months of use has worked with zero issues. Installation was painless, and has been absolutely trouble free. Don't get hung up on all the 'crap' people say you need to do with a SSD drive. Just make sure of the basics of installation are correct and just the use the thing. Most of the 'settings' are left over from the early days of SSD when they were smaller, the chips were not as good, and the Windows installation routine for SSD was not very good. But if you like geeky kind of stuff like I do, go for it, but it's not really needed.
customer_reviews.author: EZAS

customer_reviews.title: A new SSD instead of a New Laptop
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old ThinkPad has a new lease of life -thanks to this wonderful SSD from Samsung. This workhorse of a Thinkpad had maxed out its RAM at 8GB and was showing its age....I was not sue if it could take any more of the heavy workload and almost decided to buy a new laptop or a LapLet/TabLop (laptop/Tablet) I decided to give a shot with this SSD...made this my primary disk (runs Win 8.1 with 8 GB Ram) and now works just like new. I moved my original HDD into a secondary HDD. Thanks to this SSD, my Thinkpad is still (not only) functional but also blazing fast..
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Works well but instructions could be improved
customer_reviews.text: I have a notebook that holds two hard drives and was surprised that the included software will NOT work if you install the drive directly into the PC. You MUST use a USB drive adapter to clone your old drive to this one. Once I figured that out and purchased a cheap external drive adapter locally (~$10) the cloning software worked great. The solid state drive really speeds up boot time and application loading, but my main reason for buying it is to increase battery life on long flights and it does do that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce BTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It worked... and then it didn't!
customer_reviews.text: well it worked fine for almost 2 years, and then it didn't... says it's a 200 mb hard drive! boy, that takes me back to the early 90's! should I find and install doublespace? I think I'll stick to other drives that I know will work (this is my newest drive) as my SSDs from many years ago still work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dave the Pear

customer_reviews.title: Best thing you can do for a Laptop upgrade
customer_reviews.text: My wife has an older dual core Toshiba laptop with 3 GB of RAM. The HD went out twice so I decided to get her this SSD. With this SSD installed it totally out preforms my newer HP A8 Quad-Core with 16 GB of RAM, I mean it blows it out of the water!!!!! What a difference a SSD makes!!!! Windows 7 preforms like a champion!!!! SSD to Window 7 is like putting a with a 800 hp Turbo on a 200 hp car. If you are looking to upgrade your computer's performance, this is the best way to go BY FAR!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Osburn

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: Was a huge improvement over the standard HDD I was using. I use this drive for my OS and system programs, along with a few commonly played games, and a 120GB has turned out to be plenty big enough so far. My boot times and load times for software have dropped quite a bit. I've been using it for 9 months now with no problems. I'd highly recommend this drive if you want to speed up your system. It's not really for bulk storage and I still use a couple of HDDs for the majority of my files, but this is certainly an excellent boot drive.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Samsung had really good specs and reviews and I have no fuss with ...
customer_reviews.text: I feel the need for speed. I will never go back to SATA, these drives scream... Should have opted for the 256 GB though but this was my first experiment with SSD. I will store media on an external TB size drive or two and use this for the PC. Windows boots in about 10 secs from cold start! Okay that may exaggerate but it really is remarkable. Samsung had really good specs and reviews and I have no fuss with them. The drive has worked flawlessly. I did turn off windows indexing as suggested and don't miss it.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Nice and fast
customer_reviews.text: The PRO series is faster and better but more expensive. This one is quite fast and makes it nice to have a PC that boots up in seconds. Apps run very fast and given it's only 250gb it makes me stop installing all kinds of junk software I'll never use or ever need. I now also have a PRO version as my D: drive with programs installed and VMWare running several VM's. It's amazingly fast. Both use minute amounts of power. If you want fast booting and program start-ups - this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Makes everything faster and quieter.
customer_reviews.text: This is first SSD i ever purchased and I love it! I changed my HD from ASUS netbook which was very slow and getting old. As soon I changed to this product the computer got noticeably faster and the battery life is increased over 30%!!! It has been over a year now and it hasn't given me any problem so far. (and I use my computer over 6 hours a day) I am waiting for my next computer and I definitely will change to SSD.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Replaced older model with the new one
customer_reviews.text: My old SSD was dying. I needed a new one quickly and within two days the drive was at my door. My only complaint is the Samsung software included with the package was ultimately useless. I tried three times to copy my old drive to the new one with the Samsung backup software with zero success. Each time the drive either failed to boot or started with a blue screen. But I downloaded another backup application and it worked without any problems. If the Samsung software fails for you, don't waste any more time look for another backup/partition copy app.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Summerlin

customer_reviews.title: Performs well, has proven to be reliable
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this is a Lenovo W500 laptop as the main operating system disk. I actually mirrored my OS over, made sure the alignment was correct (Minitool Partition Wizard did a good job), and made the disk active. Bootup time isn't reduced as much as I'd expected, but that seems to be mostly CPU limited. What's most striking is that everything is ready to go the moment I log in. I can launch Firefox, Chrome, bring up SecureCRT - whatever I want. Things don't bog down waiting for the disk - the computer is immediately usable after bootup.
customer_reviews.author: Wireball

customer_reviews.title: The Samsung SSD's (I have two) are great! My Windows 7 64 bit boots up in ...
customer_reviews.text: SSD's will breathe new life into your old system, but you need to make the jump to making your SSD the drive for your operating system. I built a new computer system after my old system fried itself. The Samsung SSD's (I have two) are great! My Windows 7 64 bit boots up in less than 10 secs, and app loading is almost instantaneous. However, I haven't noticed much of a difference in gaming performance with games like Oblivion, Fall Out, or Rage over my 7200 RPM Western Digital.
customer_reviews.author: RectifiedGTRz

customer_reviews.title: Bought in May, 2013, Cold Dead by November, 2013
customer_reviews.text: Bought in May, Cold Dead by November. Fast, not a single problem since installation, until 1 day, it will just not boot my macbook pro 2012. Just cold Dead! Very disappointed for a big brand name. Good thing my data is backed up, otherwise, you will be looking at the sky with nothing! Will be contacting the manufacturer as I am out of return policy date through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Zam G.

customer_reviews.title: SSD is a Beast
customer_reviews.text: I've very happy with this drive. The speeds are phenomenal and the storage is big enough to remove any spinning disks from my PC and keep them in my NAS. I think the best reason to pick this up over competitors (other than it's just faster on average) is the software. I like that the Samsung Magician Software keeps the firmware updated and that I can test the speeds and other optimizations very easily. I hated looking for similar software for my other SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Ninjustin

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my late 2009 iMac
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to replace the optical disc drive in my late-2009 27" iMac (using a Sanoxy caddy) to improve performance. It works perfectly and is giving me the proper negotiated link speed (SATA II -- as fast as my system goes, but was worried about getting SATA I speeds that some have encountered with other drives). If you are considering a similar upgrade, this will do the job. It was worth paying the premium over the 840 EVO to avoid the risk of having to open the computer up again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: GAME CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: I got this solid state drive as a means to extend the life of my mid 2009 macbook pro. In it's fifth year of life it was very noticeably slowing down. There's nothing more annoying than a computer that drags down your productivity. I can now have as many applications open as I want with no signs of slowing down. Boot up is roughly thirty seconds and shut down is extremely snappy at under ten seconds. All these advantages paired with the security of a solid state drive make this the best purchase I have ever made to improve my macbook. Highly recommended especially at the current price point.
customer_reviews.author: David Newton

customer_reviews.title: Quality and reliability
customer_reviews.text: Quality and reliability I have this item for over 5 years The product is very high quality and works great
customer_reviews.author: Ofir Abramovitch

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: SSD's are fantastic and make computing on older laptops and PC's much faster. I'm the computer guy in the family and an IT Tech at work so I have people asking me all the time how to speed up their PC. NEVER use any of those ridiculous programs advertised on TV. Either have a friend clone your disk onto one of these or search on Google to figure it out for yourself. IT IS SO EASY. There are guides that walk you through every step.
customer_reviews.author: r3vi3ws4u

customer_reviews.title: PC boots in seconds, applications open in a flash!
customer_reviews.text: It's been over a year since I got this drive, and I'm still amazed at its performance. At 120GB, it doesn't offer much storage for video and music - but it should be plenty for the average user. I have mine installed in a 4 year old desktop PC with a Core 2 Quad vPro processor, 4GB of memory and Windows 7 professional. It boots in about 15 seconds - ready to work. For storage, I have a 2TB conventional drive where speed doesn't matter as much.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo6

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and durability
customer_reviews.text: Great performance and durability. Although now overshadowed by the 950 pro and 960 pro (Nvme) Pros: fast, great consistent throughput and durable (also great 5 year warranty) Cons: old technology wise, Price compared to the newer models If you get one for a good price it would still be a good performer.
customer_reviews.author: roberto zeeuw

customer_reviews.title: SSD Baby!
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade to older system, had no troubles loading os, win7 64 bit on intel core 2 duo nvidia motherboard. System boots much quicker and is more zippy! Please be aware when opening package, mine was dislodged from plastic housing and fell on table when I pulled it out.. got lucky there. Overall highly recommended just becarefull opening. My hope is that this will outlast the standard drives since it has no moving parts. So far so good, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Mondoe

customer_reviews.title: ... and 7 months now and so far it's been great. My computer (Dell XPS L502X) starts up fast ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this SSD for a year and 7 months now and so far it's been great. My computer (Dell XPS L502X) starts up fast and opening applications also loads pretty fast. I'm sure if you're going through the reviews you've already did your research on the pro's and cons about SSD's and you're probably looking for the right brand. Well so far mines hasn't crashed or brought up any errors.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse P. Jocson

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Well i wait a while until place my review on this product to see how it works in time because i've read some reviews talking about product working only for a few months and then died. For now the drive is working just fine for me, it's really fast and make my laptop much faster in every way. The missing star is because when I'm navigating in windows explorer the disk make some kind of sounf when a folder is clicked, it's weird but for now it's just that, a annoying sound nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Leyan

customer_reviews.title: Sorta good so far, we'll see how it goes. 1/3 is having 'issues'.
customer_reviews.text: Bought three; after six months, one is starting to have 'issues' (I have three of these). Switched it to a different box, still occasional disappearances from the bios, so it's probably the drive, I haven't lost any data when the drive goes down. As I use it as a giant temp drive for editing blu ray disks, it's no great loss if it dies, but I'll see what happens. Watch this space. Today's date is December 7 2013. I'll repost if it dies.
customer_reviews.author: The_Nightfly

customer_reviews.title: Installed in Macbook, works awesome
customer_reviews.text: I've been slowly upgrading all of my systems to the Samsung 840 Pro line of SSDs. Benchmarking results on my Kingston and Crucial SSDs are around 30% slower than the 840 Pro. Put this one in my 2007-2008 white Macbook and the responsiveness (even though the laptop is SATA2) is freaking awesome. In my fileserver PC and personal laptop PC which utilize the full potential of SATA3, I'm benching to about 85% of the rated max IOPS. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Went from a WD Scorpio Black spinning HD on a laptop, and saw boot up and login screen times about 1/8th of the time with the Samsung SSD. The Scorpio Black is one of the faster laptop spinning drives. Windows Experience from 5.9 to 7.7 on HD performance rating. All with a straight clone, and not a proper full clean rebuild, which would likely yield even better results. Still not bad to fully boot in 1 1/2 minutes for a fully loaded and updated machine with lots of hoggish high end modeling software, compared to almost 10 minutes before!
customer_reviews.author: Racin' Jason

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw causing degraded write speeds over time; Samsung refuses to help
customer_reviews.text: My drive has become almost entirely unusable due to slow write speeds. I have done benchmarks every 3 months over the last 2 1/2 years, and the read speed has stayed fine, but the write speed went from 250MB/s originally to 30MB/s currently. This is a well known issue for Samsung yet they are refusing to do anything about it. It is still under the 3 year warranty, but Samsung says they will not help me or replace my drive. Very poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Blueman2

customer_reviews.title: zippy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 9 months. I put it in a new Mac Mini. I have not benchmarked the performance, but the computer overall is appreciably faster to use. I also got a adapter kit from Other World Computing (OWC) that allowed me to keep the original drive in the Mini along with this drive, which I highly recommend as a way to get the best of speed and capacity in a Mac Mini.
customer_reviews.author: John Weise

customer_reviews.title: Boots very fast but gives a lot of "drive error(s)" requireing a reboot.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this drive for several years now and I did not review it until I had another solid state drive to compare it to. I just bought a SanDisk Ultra II. There is no comparison. The SanDisk boots even faster, accesses faster and the drive has had no errors (so far). The Samsung 840 has given me problems since day one. On reboot it works fine but there are a lot of reboots.
customer_reviews.author: ducatidave

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Samsung SSD's since they have been available in both mine and my clients computers. I have literally used hundreds of these drives, no kidding. The performance and quality vs. cost is second to none. The best part is that I have never seen a failure of any kind in these drives, which is absolutely amazing. I have never seen performance degradation as long as you properly set them up and properly maintain them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Savage

customer_reviews.title: All you need for documents and web browsing
customer_reviews.text: I installed this is a laptop I used just with Dropbox, a game or two, and web browsing. Basically, large storage was not necessary, and the speed increase was the right choice. I have since moved it to a new laptop that also has a HDD. No failures, 2.0 second start time... It's great. I use a 120GB one in my Desktop for OS and programs. That one filled up too quickly. 250GB is the perfect size for that use.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about buying a TLC SSD. But it was on sale for a good price, and was well worth the money. I have had absolutely no issues. It's plugged into a SATA II port so I couldn't say how fast it actually is. It saturates the IO quite nicely, is very responsive, and was a MASSIVE upgrade over the old 320GB 10k RPM Raptor drive it's replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Labrow

customer_reviews.title: If I'm not jynxing the thing by saying so, ...
customer_reviews.text: If I'm not jynxing the thing by saying so, I bought this SSD as "refurbished" and it has performed well, withstanding a couple of re-partitionings since I'd bought it 16 months ago. I haven't done any empriical tests for speed or performance, but let's face it, it's hard to review something which poses no problems.
customer_reviews.author: O-man

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my aging Intel 80GB SSD of 3 years with this new one from Samsung. Even though my Intel Core i7-860 system only has 3GBs ports, rather than the new 6GBs ports, this drive is noticeably faster than my old trusty Intel SSD. Samsung's included migration software makes cloning your old drive a breeze! The Magician software configures your drive for you, and updates the firmware. If you can get this drive at a great price, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Lance D. Ripplinger

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic performance
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive to be the second drive in my laptop that I run multiple VMs on for demos. I was originally running a standard hard drive as the second drive and the performance was less than optimal. OK, it stank. I moved the VMs to this drive as the second drive in the expansion bay and WOW. The VMs all run extremely well. I need to get another one to replace the main drive in the system now.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: SSD's are in!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to speed up your machine, or just to have some reliable storage space, I highly recommend getting one of these as your boot drive. Being a Developer, I have many things running on all of my machines simultaneously, with enough RAM this was fine, it's that startup that killed me. Pulled my MacBook Pro from about a 80-90 second startup, down to 15 seconds! Restarting you can literally miss it's so fast. Love this drive!
customer_reviews.author: itsRhen

customer_reviews.title: 10 second boots
customer_reviews.text: Getting 10 second boots with this thing. Windows index rating gives it a 7.9. But it gets it's space eaten quickly with an OS and a few big HD games. Windows, WoW, Skyrim and your already eating up over 100gb. Has screw holes on bottom to match with 2.5 installation bays. I ordered the one without a bracket because it was easy to install w/out it, it was pretty unnecessary to pay the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Fast!

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Electronics Samsung 840 Series Solid State Drive (SSD) 500 GB
customer_reviews.text: Used this drive as a replacement for original 150gb drive in my core i7 system. Windows 7 performance rating is a 7.9 out of a possible 7.9. Can't top that. Easy to set up and everything needed was available either in the box or online.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P.

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome SSD. There were several reviews criticizing the use of TLC NAND (three bits per cell) over MLC NAND (two bits per cell) and the longevity of TLC, but the fact that 2.5 million of these have been sold as of 7/25/13 with few problems to report of is good news for TLC. I have several 830's in use, a few 840's, and one 840 EVO. All of them have been working great from Day 1.
customer_reviews.author: BiG 10

customer_reviews.title: Great solid state drive!
customer_reviews.text: This drive brought life back into my Mid 2010 Macbook Pro! The computer is now blazing fast and I can actually stand to use it again! I would definitely recommend upgrading your main hard to a solid state drive regardless of is you are using a laptop or desktop! An SSD is a must have! If you have an Ultrabook make sure it takes a 9mm and not a 7mm drive. I am not positive, but I believe it is a 9mm drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Love This Drive
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a new build in June of 2013 as a boot drive (have a 1 TB HDD for data storage), and so far I'm loving this drive. I have it running a dual boot (Win 8 & Linux Mint), and both OS's boot up super fast without any problems. It was easy to install, my BIOS recognized the drive right off the bat, and both operating systems installed without any problems (had to install Win 8 first).
customer_reviews.author: G. Golden

customer_reviews.author: A. Doherty

customer_reviews.title: great ssd

The space is getting cheaper every day, and they are super durable.

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing

I Also play league of legends which is a game I installed onto the SSD and I load the game sometimes before people even connnected.

My SSD Speeds: Link Speed: 6 Gigabit Negotiated Link Speed: 6 Gigabit Write: 240.8MB/s Read: 499.2MB/s Very happy with the results and stability.

(Which writes a bit faster).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: A.M.A.Z.I.N.G.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little monster for my I7 2.6 Quad core / 8GB DDR3 Laptop, mainly for the battery savings and improved heat dissipation HOWEVER what really amazed me is how much my PC SPEED improved! I want to buy the bigger (256GB) version -- Let's admit it, 120GB *might* be a tight fit in the HD world we live nowadays but you can still do the same as I did and get a USB enclosure for your old disk. Come to the dark erhh I mean SSD side. You'll never regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Kemuel Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Makes Windows boot faster

customer_reviews.title: This really sped up my old MacBook
customer_reviews.text: This was the single best for upgrade that I made for my old MacBook Pro. I can't tell you how much this sped up my computer. It almost seems like a brand-new laptop. Solid-state technology is so much faster than regular hard drives. I don't think I'll ever buy a laptop without a solid-state drive again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich L.

customer_reviews.title: Been using for 6 months

customer_reviews.author: Jay P

customer_reviews.title: I love this SSD
customer_reviews.text: I love this SSD. I put it inside of my Qosmio x70 as my main drive. My boot speeds are amazingly fast with this little guy, less that 10 seconds into Windows 8. I'm not too sure about the read/write speeds but those can be looked up anywhere. I would recommend to a friend.

customer_reviews.title: Samsung SSD

SSD boot times/write times are nice, but in the future may be more inclined to just buy a regular drive so if it flakes in a short period like this one i can just toss it and replace it cheaply.
